cyclone.name: ANA
cyclone.current_location: about 170 miles south-southeast of Myrtle Beach, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Moving slowly north, forecast to turn northwest and approach the central South Carolina coast, then drift inland and lift northeast along the U.S. East Coast before emerging offshore early next week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central South Carolina coast (between Charleston and Myrtle Beach)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach, SC to Cape Lookout, NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: southeast U.S. coast from northern Florida through North Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Bands from Ana could produce occasional squalls with gusts near tropical-storm force (35-40 mph) at the port Saturday into early Sunday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation possible at high tide, but significant surge (>3 ft) is not expected for Savannah.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands may bring 1â€“3 inches of rain to the Savannah area over the weekend.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Hazardous surf and rip currents could affect approaches to the harbor.
